answers.answer: Hi there and welcome.  Well, YES.  You should always be properly diagnosed before taking an antibiotic.Couple of things come to mind.  You say you had this smell when pregnant and that was the last time (amazing you can remember back that far to identify the smell)---  could this be hormonally related?  As we get into our 40's, our hormones do change.  That could change our smell.  We also can sometimes not have as great of pelvic floor muscles and urine can leak (which is also common during pregnancy).  Typically yeast infections not only have a bit of an odor but also have a thick discharge and itching along with it.  and it is said that sometimes what we can eat can affect our bodily smells for sure.  Diabetes can change the smell of our urine and could cause this situation as well.In truth, I think you should see about going to the doctor for a proper diagnosis of this.  While it may feel a little embarrassing, it is best to get to the root of the problem.  wishing you lots of luck dear

question: Hi.  I'm 44.  About a week ago, I started getting this unusual odor 'down there'.  It's the same smell I had when I was pregnant 17 yrs. ago--& haven't had that since then--until now.  It's not fishy or real bad, just unusual.   No itching, burning, pain, etc.  Nothing.  I take a shower every morning & wash using feminine wash as usual.  I notice this smell even at work while sitting at my desk, so I'm worried everyone else may notice.  I've taken 5 days of Bactrim (I know, I should ask a Dr. first)  that I had here in case I have an infection.  So far, it's not working.  Could it just be a simple yeast infection?  I bought the 3 Day Monistat yesterday hoping that may help!   Thanks for any advice.  (ps:  this may be a long shot, but I had been eating garlic chips, garlic crackers, salsa daily, etc.  I buy anything that says garlic or jalapeno.....)   I just want this gone and be back to normal  !!    :-(
title: Vaginal Odor
